text: , also known as Ezo and Yezo, is a volcanic island in Japan. It is the northernmost of Japan's four main islands.Library of Congress Country Studies, Japan (LOC), "Geographic Regions, Hokkaido". Retrieved 13 February 2012. Hokkaidō Prefecture covers the entire island.Japan External Trade Organization (JETRO), Hokkaido Prefecture, Regional Information . Retrieved 6 April 2012. About 5,224,614 people live on the island. It is north of Honshu. It is the second largest Japanese island.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2002). "Hokkaido" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 343. It has a humid continental climate (Dfa/Dfb in the Köppen climate classification) with cold snowy winters and warm to hot summers. Agriculture is an important part of the island's economy. ==Regions== Hokkaidō region is one of Japan's traditional geographic regions.Nussbaum, "Geography" at p. 242. The region covers the entire island. The island and the region have been called Hokkaidō since 1869. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan ==References== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Islands of Japan Category:Hokkaido Prefecture
title: Hokkaidō
